items.title: 50 rising startups in Singapore
items.summary:
- A list of startups in Singapore that have recently raised funding.
- The list includes companies up to the series E stage.
- Each entry provides key details about the funding round.

items.title: Insta360 gains IPO approval in mainland China
items.summary:
- Chinese imaging company [Insta360](https://www.techinasia.com/news/insta360-gains-ipo-approval-mainland-china) receives approval for its IPO in mainland China.
- Founded in Shenzhen in 2015, Insta360 holds a 67.2% global market share in panoramic and action cameras.
- Revenue increased from 13.3 billion yuan (US$1.83 billion) in 2021 to 36.4 billion yuan (US$5 billion) in 2023.
- Net profits rose from 2.66 billion yuan (US$365.47 million) in 2021 to 8.30 billion yuan (US$1.14 billion) in 2023.
- The company invests over 12% of its revenue in R&D, totaling 8.54 billion yuan (US$1.17 billion) from 2021 to 2023.
- More than half of the workforce is focused on R&D, with over 800 patents held.
- Insta360 operates in over 200 countries and sells through platforms like Amazon and Tmall, also partnering with Leica, Google, and Apple.

items.title: Taiwan says TSMC needs gov’t approval for overseas ventures
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s economy minister states that TSMC requires government approval for overseas joint ventures.
- TSMC is reportedly in discussions to acquire a stake in Intel, but details are unconfirmed.
- The government fully supports TSMC but emphasizes regulatory oversight for international investments.
- TSMC is investing $65 billion in new facilities in Arizona, also needing government approval.
- Taiwan's government is analyzing potential US tariffs due to trade imbalances for better negotiation outcomes with the US administration.

items.title: Amazon to launch genAI-powered Alexa in US this March
items.summary:
- Amazon has launched **Alexa+**, a generative AI-powered version of its voice assistant.
- The service will be available in the **US starting in March**.
- Alexa+ allows users to make reservations, order products online, and enables more natural conversations.
- Future updates will include **Japanese language support**.
- The new version learns from user interactions to improve responses.
- There are **600 million Alexa-enabled devices** in use globally, showing the potential impact of generative AI.

items.title: Arm expands in South Korea with AI chip designs for IoT
items.author: Hwang Seon-wook
items.summary:
- Arm introduced its Armv9 Edge AI platform for IoT devices in South Korea, featuring the Cortex-A320 CPU and Ethos-U85 neural processing unit.
- The platform enables AI processing on devices, reducing reliance on cloud services.
- The Cortex-A320 CPU offers a tenfold increase in machine learning capabilities and a 30% boost in scalar performance over the Cortex-A35.
- Production is set for 2026, with client evaluations already underway.
- Arm emphasizes its commitment to helping developers create AI-driven chips and solutions.

items.title: Bitcoin miner TeraWulf revenue soars 102%, stocks up 14%
items.summary:
- TeraWulf reported a 102% increase in annual revenue for 2024, reaching US$140.1 million, up from US$69.2 million in 2023.
- Growth driven by higher bitcoin production and improved prices; non-GAAP adjusted EBITDA nearly doubled to US$60.4 million.
- Company eliminated US$139.4 million legacy term loan debt and plans to add 72.5 megawatts of hosting capacity for HPC in 2025.
- TeraWulf's stock rose 14% after the earnings report, bringing market valuation to US$1.57 billion.

items.title: China’s high-tech zones host 67% of unicorns, gov’t says
items.summary:
- By the end of 2024, 67% of China’s unicorn firms will be in national high-tech industrial development zones.
- These 178 zones host one-third of high-tech enterprises and 46% of specialized SMEs.
- In the AI sector, they contain 60% of publicly listed AI companies and nearly half of AI unicorns.
- In 2024, GDP of these zones grew by 7.6%, with import and export volumes reaching 9.5 trillion yuan (US$1.31 trillion).
- The government plans to further develop these zones by integrating with national science and technology resources.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.summary:
- The article explores the funding landscape in Southeast Asia, focusing on trends and key investors.
- It includes a section called 'weekly update' with recent investor and company insights.
- The 'macro trends' section summarizes funding distribution across countries and sectors.
- The content is premium and requires a subscription for full access.

items.title: OpenAI plans Sora video generator integration into ChatGPT
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- OpenAI is integrating the Sora video generator into ChatGPT.
- This integration aims to enhance the multimedia capabilities of ChatGPT.
- The move is part of OpenAI's ongoing efforts to expand the functionalities of its AI models.

items.title: US VC firm General Catalyst considers IPO
items.summary:
- General Catalyst is exploring an IPO, potentially becoming the first US-based VC firm to go public.
- The firm has not yet hired investment bankers or set a timeline for the IPO process.
- The move follows previous trends of private equity firms like Blackstone going public.
- The firm is expanding its operations by entering areas like healthcare, wealth management, and tech advisory, raising US$8 billion for new VC funds.
- General Catalyst is transitioning into a broader financial company similar to Blackstone and Apollo.
- Other VC firms have considered IPOs, but General Catalyst appears further along in the process.
- The potential IPO occurs amid a slowdown in public offerings from portfolio companies, shifting focus to VC firms as IPO candidates.

items.title: Intel delays $28b Ohio chip project to 2030 after cost cuts
items.summary:
- Intel's $28 billion chip manufacturing project in Ohio is delayed to 2030.
- The first factory will start operations between 2030 and 2031, and the second will begin in 2032.
- Delay attributed to Intel's capital expenditure adjustments following costly entry into the contract chip manufacturing market.
- Major cost-saving measures implemented in 2024 include 15% workforce layoffs and suspension of dividends.
- Operating expenses targeted at approximately $17.5 billion in 2025.

items.title: US food delivery firm Grubhub lays off over 20% of workforce
items.summary:
- Grubhub is laying off over 20% of its workforce, equating to about 500 employees.
- The layoffs are part of a restructuring after its acquisition by Wonder, finalized last month.
- Grubhub had more than 2,200 full-time employees before the job cuts.
- The company was sold to Wonder in 2024 for US$650 million, resulting in a significant loss for its previous owner, Just Eat Takeaway.
- Grubhub is partnering with Avride to introduce delivery robots on US college campuses to address labor challenges.

items.title: Vietnam’s PM pushes Starlink trial
items.summary:
- Vietnam's Prime Minister has initiated a trial for Starlink services in the country.
- The trial aims to improve internet access in remote and rural areas.
- Starlink is a satellite internet constellation being deployed by SpaceX, offering high-speed broadband service globally.

items.title: UK chip firm Arm to establish Malaysia base
items.summary:
- Arm Holdings Plc will formalize an agreement to set up a base in Malaysia next week, as announced by Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.
- This decision follows discussions between Arm's CEO and SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son.
- Arm Holdings, known for semiconductor and software design, particularly CPU architectures, aims to invest in Malaysia due to its political stability, though there are concerns about workforce readiness.

items.title: Taiwan-based Wiwynn Corp invests $300 million in US manufacturing facility
items.summary:
- Wiwynn Corp plans to invest US$300 million in its first manufacturing facility in the US to adjust its supply chain.
- Currently operates manufacturing sites in Taiwan, Mexico, and Malaysia.
- Allocating NT$8 billion (US$243.8 million) for a new facility in Southern Science Park, Taiwan, a 29% increase over initial estimates.
- Supplies major cloud service providers like Meta Platforms and Microsoft.
- AI-enabled server sales comprised 50% of its revenue in Q4 2024, up from 20% in Q1.
- Reported record net profits of NT$7.05 billion (US$214.25 million) in Q4 2024, doubling from the previous year.
- Annual net profits rose 89% to NT$22.78 billion (US$692.3 million) with revenue growing 49% to NT$360.54 billion (US$10.96 billion).

items.title: Bumble appoints new interim CFO as growth slows
items.summary:
- Bumble Inc. appointed Ronald Fior as interim CFO starting March 15.
- Fior has over 30 years of CFO experience and replaces Anu Subramanian.
- The leadership change occurs as Bumble faces challenges with revenue growth and a decline in paying users, predicting a drop of 100,000 to 120,000 paying users.
- Whitney Wolfe Herd is set to return as CEO, following other executive shifts.

items.title: DeepSeek says its AI profit margin could reach 545%
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, announced on Mar. 1 that its theoretical profit margin for online services could reach 545% based on V3 and R1 model performance over 24 hours.
- The company provided disclaimers that the profit margins don't account for unmonetized services, off-peak discounts, or R&D expenses.
- This announcement comes amid scrutiny over AI industry profitability as startups like OpenAI and Anthropic look for diverse revenue models.
- DeepSeek is gaining attention for cost-effective AI development and aims to compete with Silicon Valley firms.
- Recent developments include multiple AI model disclosures and significant discounts during off-peak hours.

items.title: The quantum question
items.summary:
- Quantum computing is making significant advancements, with firms like Google indicating commercial applications could arrive within five years.
- Israeli firm Quantum Machines raised US$170 million in a Series C funding round to enhance its quantum computing technology.
- Other significant funding activities included Blinkit raising US$172 million and Techcoop securing US$70 million in Vietnam.
- The article lists multiple mergers and acquisitions, including GajiGesa being acquired by Kredivo for US$12 million.
- Fundraising for startups continues to be a challenging process, and a new platform, Glasswall, aims to provide transparency and feedback on investor interactions.

items.title: Meet the 80 top-funded startups and tech companies in Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists 80 startups and tech companies in Southeast Asia ranked by funding raised over the last two years.
- It utilizes data from Tech in Asia to highlight which companies are leading in funding to pioneer a new economy.
- The article is categorized as premium content and requires a subscription for full access.

items.title: VinFast, Motech partner to expand EV services in Philippines
items.summary:
- VinFast partners with Motech Automotive Service Centers to expand EV service network in the Philippines.
- 63 Motech workshops will be accredited as authorized service centers, aiming for over 100 by year-end.
- Partnership includes training, technical support, and joint marketing initiatives to enhance after-sales services.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Southeast Asia
China’s smartphone sales surge with gov’t subsidy: report
items.summary:
- A report from Counterpoint Research on Feb. 27 reveals a government subsidy program boosted smartphone sales in China.
- Huawei led January sales, followed by Vivo and Xiaomi, together capturing 54% of nearly 29 million units sold.
- The smartphone market experienced a 17% year-on-year increase, primarily for devices priced between 2,000 and 5,000 yuan (US$275–US$688).
- A government scheme launched on Jan. 20 offers a 15% subsidy on products under 6,000 yuan (US$824.36).
- Sales surged to over 9.5 million units in the first week of the program, a 65% increase from the previous year.
- Subsidies are expected to contribute 2 to 3 percentage points to first-quarter sales growth but do not apply to premium models like Apple’s iPhone 16 series.

items.title: China’s robotics firm Unitree warns investors of share scams
items.summary:
- Unitree Robotics warns investors of share scams in a WeChat post on Feb. 27.
- All share transactions must go through their financing department without intermediaries.
- Interest in Unitree surged after founder Wang Xinxing attended a business symposium with President Xi Jinping.
- Wang, at 35, was the youngest tech executive present at the event alongside leaders like Huawei’s Ren Zhengfei and Alibaba’s Jack Ma.
- Unitree’s H1 humanoid robots gained attention during this year’s Spring Festival Gala.
- Zhejiang Changsheng Sliding Bearings reported its share price more than tripled in 2025 due to increased market activity.
- The warning aims to protect investors amid rising interest in the robotics sector.

items.title: DeepSeek wraps up week of AI model disclosures
items.summary:
- DeepSeek released eight open-source projects on GitHub to optimize model training efficiency.
- This marks DeepSeek's first disclosure, attracting global developer attention.
- The releases occur during debates about open-source practices in AI, contrasting with OpenAI's private model training details.
- No future disclosures or projects from DeepSeek have been announced.

items.title: Saudi developer Umm Al Qura IPO gets $126b in orders
items.summary:
- Umm Al Qura, a Saudi developer, received $126 billion in orders for its IPO.
- The high demand signifies strong investor interest in Saudi real estate sector.
- The IPO is part of broader economic reforms and diversification efforts in Saudi Arabia.

items.title: French call-center firm uses AI to modify accents
items.summary:
- Teleperformance SE, a France-based company, uses AI to modify Indian call center agents' accents in real time.
- Developed by Sanas, the AI technology improves communication by softening accents and includes background noise cancellation features.
- Teleperformance has invested US$13 million in Sanas and is the exclusive reseller of the service, currently available in India and supporting Filipino accents with plans for expansion.
- This investment is part of a larger €100 million (US$103.75 million) AI initiative planned for 2025.
- Teleperformance employs 490,000 globally, reporting €2.68 billion (US$2.78 billion) in Q4 2024 revenue, a 12% increase from the previous year, with an expected 3-5% growth in 2025.

items.title: Blinkit launches 10-minute Apple product delivery in India
items.summary:
- Blinkit, owned by Zomato, now delivers Apple products within 10 minutes in select Indian cities such as Delhi NCR, Mumbai, and Hyderabad.
- This service is part of Blinkit’s expansion in the electronics sector, which previously included rapid delivery for laptops and monitors through brands like Lenovo and HP.
- Apple is increasing its presence in India with local production of the iPhone 16e and record exports of ₹1 lakh crore (approximately US$11.43 billion) in 2024, along with the launch of the Apple Store app in India.

items.title: India’s EV market grows 29% in 2024, Tata leads car market
items.summary:
- India's EV market registered a 29% growth in 2024, with nearly 2 million total registrations.
- Electric car sales doubled to 147,000 units, with Tata Motors as the market leader.
- Two-wheelers accounted for 60% of registrations at 1.14 million units, led by Ola Electric and TVS.
- Electric three-wheelers grew by 12.8%, with Mahindra and Bajaj Auto as key players.
- Government subsidies and the PM E-drive scheme contributed significantly to market expansion.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- A compilation of fundraising startups for subscribers.  
- Startup owners can sign up for listings to reach investors at [this link](https://www.techinasia.com/companies/fundraising).  
- Investors can opt-in for curated startup lists if they are paying subscribers at [this link](https://form.typeform.com/to/XHpDNvii).

items.title: UAE-based fintech Flow48 bags $69m series A
items.author: Idriss Al Rifai
items.summary:
- Flow48 raised US$69 million in a series A funding round of debt and equity.
- The funding round was led by Breega, with participation from several investors.
- Flow48 offers upfront financing to SMEs by converting future revenues into immediate capital.
- The company plans to use the funding for expansion into the UAE and Saudi Arabia.
- In November 2023, Flow48 previously secured US$25 million in a pre-series A round.
- Flow48 aims to improve financial solutions for SMEs using alternative data and risk assessment tools.
- The fintech addresses the underdeveloped SME financing in the region to support economic growth.

items.title: Flipkart shuts commerce unit ahead of planned IPO
items.summary:
- Flipkart closed Ans Commerce, a SaaS platform acquired in 2022.
- Ans Commerce, founded in 2017, fulfilled over 600,000 orders for brands before closure.
- Approximately 110 employees are affected; Flipkart is providing severance and internal opportunities.
- Ans Commerce raised $2.2 million in 2021 but joins other startups that have shut down recently.
- Closure coincides with Flipkart's preparation for a public listing in the next 12 to 18 months, involving cost-cutting and restructuring.

items.title: Osome achieved profitability in Q4 2024
items.author: Victor Lysenko
items.summary:
- Singapore-based online accounting startup Osome achieved profitability in Q4 2024.
- Osome claims to have supported thousands of business founders by managing their accounting processes.
- CEO Victor Lysenko credits relentless focus on automation and efficiency for the achievement.
- Recent developments include a 25% revenue growth in 2024 and plans for expansion in Singapore and Hong Kong.
- Osome previously faced challenges including staff layoffs and customer backlash due to service issues in early 2024.

items.title: FBI links $1.5b Bybit crypto theft to North Korean hackers
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The FBI has linked a $1.5 billion theft from Bybit, a cryptocurrency exchange, to North Korean hackers.
- This connection is part of a broader investigation into the country's involvement in cybercrime for financial gain.
- The theft is considered one of the largest in the history of cryptocurrency.

items.title: India drives Coursera’s enterprise growth as AI surges
items.summary:
- Coursera identifies India as a key growth market in the enterprise segment, alongside West Asia.
- The enterprise business in India is expanding rapidly, with nearly 30% of global campus customers located there.
- The enterprise contribution in India has surpassed its consumer business, which is unusual globally.
- Coursera's global B2B segment made up 34% of total revenue in 2024, increasing from 29% in 2021.
- India holds the position as Coursera’s second-largest consumer market with 28 million registered users and the highest enrollments in 2024, surpassing the US.
- AI courses, especially in generative AI, have seen significant engagement, with 1.3 million enrollments in 2024, nearly half from enterprise clients.

items.title: Foxconn begins $137m HQ in China for EVs, energy storage
items.summary:
- Foxconn Technology Group has commenced construction of a global headquarters for its New Business Development Group in Zhengzhou, China.
- The facility will focus on electric vehicles (EVs), energy storage, and emerging industries.
- The groundbreaking ceremony took place on February 27, attended by Foxconn CEO Liu Young-way and Henan provincial governor Wang Kai.
- The site spans 70,000 square meters with a development budget of 1 billion yuan (US$137 million).
- This project supports Foxconn’s strategy to diversify from being solely an Apple supplier, as it has expanded into EVs, semiconductors, robotics, and AI since 2019.

items.title: YouTube star MrBeast seeks funding at $5b valuation
items.author: Jimmy Donaldson
items.summary:
- YouTube creator Jimmy Donaldson (MrBeast) seeks to raise several hundred million dollars, valuing his company at approximately US$5 billion.
- Funds will support a holding company managing his ventures, including Feastables and Lunchly.
- His enterprises generated over US$400 million in revenue last year, aiming to expand consumer goods and media operations.
- MrBeast has ventured into streaming with 'Beast Games' on Amazon Prime Video, which is the platform's most-watched unscripted series.
- He has previously raised funds from Alpha Wave Global and was linked to a bid for TikTok.

items.title: Indian tech firm launches 10-minute diagnostic drone delivery
items.summary:
- An Indian tech firm has introduced a drone delivery service that can provide diagnostic tests in just 10 minutes.
- The service aims to improve healthcare accessibility in remote areas by facilitating faster medical testing.
- Drones are expected to deliver medical samples and receive results quickly, enhancing patient care.

items.title: Microsoft to shut down Skype in 2025, shifts focus to Teams
items.summary:
- Microsoft will discontinue Skype in May 2025, transitioning users to Teams.
- Daily Skype users decreased from 300 million in 2016 to 36 million in 2023.
- Teams now boasts 320 million monthly users, bolstered by AI features.

items.title: The top lenders to SEA’s and India’s tech companies
items.summary:
- Debt is increasingly popular among tech companies in Southeast Asia and India.  
- Granite Asia has adopted a multi-asset investment strategy to support founders with equity and debt.  
- The shift from growth at all costs to sustainable growth has made firms with sustainable growth more appealing to lenders due to lower default rates.

items.title: Ex-CEO weighs in on eFishery fiasco
items.author: Gibran Huzaifah
items.summary:
- eFishery was once a unicorn but faced allegations of inflating revenues by over US$600 million.
- Former CEO Gibran Huzaifah apologized to employees and farmers but declined to comment on the ongoing investigation.
- Huzaifah denied personal gain from revenue inflation, stating he refrained from selling shares during series D funding.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Southeast Asia’s startups
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most active investors in Southeast Asia's startups over the past 12 months.
- It features investors who have invested in three or more companies in the region during this time.
- The data is being updated continuously, emphasizing the focus on early-stage investors while working on better representation of each firm's impact.

items.title: Thailand, Baidu partner to rebuild Chinese tourist confidence
items.summary:
- Thailand's Tourism Authority has teamed up with Baidu to enhance its appeal to Chinese tourists after safety issues.
- The partnership, initiated on Feb. 27, employs digital marketing and AI to combat negative perceptions.
- A recent incident involving the disappearance of Chinese actor Wang Xing affected bookings during the Lunar New Year.
- Thailand aims to attract more quality Chinese tourists by 2025, seeking to return to pre-pandemic tourist levels of 40 million by the end of that year.
- In 2024, Thailand received 6.73 million Chinese visitors among 35.54 million international arrivals, with tourism contributing significantly to the economy.

items.title: 20 largest exits in SEA
TikTok to invest $8.8b in Thai data centers by 2029
items.author: Helena Lersch
items.summary:
- TikTok plans to invest US$8.8 billion in data centers in Thailand over the next five years.
- Announcement made by vice president Helena Lersch during an event in Bangkok on Feb. 28.
- The connection to a prior US$3.8 billion agreement with Thailand’s investment board is unclear.

items.title: Tencent launches new AI model to rival DeepSeek
items.summary:
- Tencent has launched the AI model Hunyuan Turbo S, which responds to user queries faster than DeepSeek’s R1 model, with a response time of under one second.
- Hunyuan Turbo S performs on par with DeepSeek’s V3 in terms of knowledge, mathematics, and reasoning capabilities.
- DeepSeek’s V3 powers their popular AI chatbot, which leads in app store downloads.
- DeepSeek has not yet responded to Tencent’s claims regarding the Turbo S.

items.title: Alibaba to hire 3,000 interns with focus on AI roles
items.summary:
- Alibaba Group is launching a hiring campaign for 3,000 internships, focusing nearly half on AI roles.
- The program targets students graduating between November 2025 and October 2026 across various business units.
- Over 80% of the AI-focused internships will be within Alibaba Cloud, amid a workforce shortage in China prompted by rising AI demand.

items.title: Bitcoin tumbles to $80k for first time since November
items.summary:
- Bitcoin dropped below US$80,000 on Feb. 28, reaching US$79,666.
- The decline marks its lowest point since Nov. 11, 2024, with a decrease of over 5% in one day.
- The drop in value is attributed to reduced optimism for US digital currency support and uncertainty regarding President Trump’s tariff plans.
- Bitcoin's market value has decreased by approximately 25% since its peak of over US$105,000 in mid-December.
- The situation is worsened by a US$1.5 billion hack of rival cryptocurrency ether.

items.title: EFishery ex-CEO calls billion-rupiah salary claim ‘untrue’
items.author: Gibran Huzaifah
items.summary:
[ Gibran Huzaifah denies claims of a gross monthly salary of 1.28 billion rupiah (US$74,951) for 2024. ]
[ Tech in Asia found Huzaifah's documented salary to be approximately 313 million rupiah (US$19,138) monthly, a quarter of the reported figure. ]
[ It's uncertain how the inflated salary figure was calculated; Huzaifah's bonuses reportedly range from one to two months' salary, requiring board approval. ]

items.title: Asian chip stocks drop as Nvidia slumps after earnings miss
items.summary:
- Asian chip stocks fell significantly following Nvidia's disappointing earnings report.
- Nvidia's share price declined by 10% as it missed revenue expectations.
- The slump in Asian chip stocks raises concerns about the overall semiconductor market performance.

items.title: IBM completes $6.4b cloud automation acquisition
items.summary:
- IBM finalized its acquisition of HashiCorp for US$6.4 billion on Feb. 27, at US$35 per share in cash.
- This acquisition enhances IBM's hybrid cloud and automation capabilities, incorporating HashiCorp’s infrastructure automation and security tools.
- HashiCorp’s Terraform and Vault will integrate with IBM’s existing technologies, such as Red Hat and watsonx, to improve IT infrastructure and security processes.
- The deal aims to support enterprises in managing hybrid cloud environments by combining public cloud services with on-premises data centers.
- IBM anticipates a demand surge for scalable infrastructure automation, forecasting 1 billion new cloud-native applications by 2028 due to generative AI.
